text: Count Wolrad II 'the Scholar' of Waldeck-Eisenberg (27 March 1509 – 15 April 1578), , was since 1539 Count of Waldeck-Eisenberg. By Wolrad and his relatives from the cadet branches, the Reformation in the County of Waldeck was almost completed. They defied the Emperor, had to fight for pardon, but remained Protestant and enforced the Reformation in their county. In the process, Wolrad took a leading position in the spiritual field.Haarmann (2014), pp. 20–21. ==References== Category:1509 births Category:1578 deaths Category:Princes of Waldeck and Pyrmont
title: Wolrad II the Scholar
